alert.note: Alert for Coshocton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 1:29AM EST until January 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC031-031830- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0001.000000T0000Z-220104T0900Z/ /CSHO1.1.ER.220102T1715Z.220103T1200Z.220104T0300Z.NO/ 129 AM EST Mon Jan 3 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At Coshocton. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water reaches low lying areas between Tuscarawas and Walhonding Rivers just upstream of the confluence of the two rivers. At 15.0 feet, Low areas are flooded and water reaches a few homes along Route 16 south of Coshocton and along County Route 1A north of Coshocton. At 16.0 feet, Flood waters begin to affect the Lake Park area along the Walhonding River and begins backwater flooding along Mill Creek north of Lake Park and along Route 83. Flood waters will begin to enter yards in low-lying areas along County Route 1A. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 AM EST Monday was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain nearly steady at a crest of 15.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.2 feet on 02/04/1988. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
